head.title: After Injuring Her Groin, Fifth-Seeded Mauresmo Loses

hedline.hl1: After Injuring Her Groin, Fifth-Seeded Mauresmo Loses
hedline.hl2: After Injuring Her Groin, Fifth-Seeded Mauresmo Loses

block.p: During the first set of her third-round match Saturday, Amélie Mauresmo felt a twinge in her right groin, and right then, her chances at winning the French Open vanished.
Even after a doctor wrapped her leg, the fifth-seeded Mauresmo said the injury continued to bother her, causing her to lose to Lucie Safarova, 6-3, 7-6 (3).
The fifth-seeded Amélie Mauresmo lost to Lucie Safarova, 6-3, 7-6 (3), in the third round at the French Open.
During the first set of her third-round match Saturday, Amélie Mauresmo felt a twinge in her right groin, and right then, her chances at winning the French Open vanished.
Even after a doctor wrapped her leg, the fifth-seeded Mauresmo said the injury continued to bother her, causing her to lose to Lucie Safarova, 6-3, 7-6 (3).
''There's no miracle today,'' she said. ''I've been struggling for weeks now, and as I said coming here at the French Open, I didn't really know what to expect.''
Safarova, seeded 25th, also defeated Mauresmo at the Australian Open this year in the fourth round, preventing Mauresmo from repeating as the champion at that Grand Slam event.
Mauresmo won the Australian Open and Wimbledon last year, in her best season as a professional. Those victories took the pressure off her coming into the French Open, she said.
The furthest she has advanced at Roland Garros has been the quarterfinals, twice.
As the highest-seeded Frenchwoman, Mauresmo was the fan favorite here, with the crowd chanting her name Saturday even as she exited the court.

But for Mauresmo, winning her first French Open was a long shot. She had her appendix removed in March, so her preparation for this tournament had not been as smooth as planned. Safarova took advantage of that.
''It was very tough,'' Safarova said. ''I was very nervous at the beginning because I know that the crowd is for her.
''I tried to come for each point, to play aggressive. I think that's why I won.''
